Let the real functions $f_1(x)$, $f_2(x)$, ... be defined in the
interval $[a, b]$. If they all the condition
$$|f_n(x)| \leqq M_n \quad \forall\,x\in[a, b],$$ with
$\sum_{n = 1}^{\infty}M_n$ a convergent series of , then the function
series $$f_1(x)\!+\!f_2(x)\!+\!\cdots$$ on the interval $[a, b]$.

The theorem is valid also for the series with complex function terms,
when one replaces the interval with a subset of $\mathbb{C}$.
